title: Bindi Irwin's cousin Rebecca Lobie struggles to contain her ample assets in a black swimsuit
text:
She may hail from the same wholesome Irwin clan as animal conservationist Bindi.

But when it comes to flaunting her fantastic physique, Rebecca Lobie isn't shy.

The 32-year-old niece of the late Crocodile Hunter Steve Irwin, took to Instagram to share a racy photo of herself on Friday.

Swimsuit stunner! Bindi Irwin's cousin Rebecca Lobie struggled to contain her ample assets as she posed in a black one-piece in her latest Instagram post

Taking a selfie, she posed wearing a black one piece that struggled to contain her ample assets while the high cut of the suit accentuated her curves.

She also showed off her pout in the snap, as well as her pink manicure.

'Early morning start for a long weekend,' she wrote in the caption of her racy post.

Fans complimented the stunner on the raunchy photo, with one writing: 'I'd like to take you to the movies but they don't allow snacks.'

Bikini babe: 'Looks like someone is ready for the weekend,' another added. Rebecca recently shared a sultry throwback snap, in which she gave a flirty look to the camera while soaking up the sun in a tiny blue bikini

'Looks like someone is ready for the weekend,' another added.

Rebecca recently shared a sultry throwback snap, in which she gave a flirty look to the camera while soaking up the sun in a tiny blue bikini.

She added a hint of glamour to her summer look by wearing an 'R' necklace around her neck, and crossed her legs in the air behind her as she enjoyed her day of relaxation.

Happier times with Bindi: According to her LinkedIn account, Rebecca left her job as managing director of the Irwin's Australia Zoo in December 2015 (Pictured left to right Rebecca, her son and Bindi Irwin at Australia Zoo in November 2014)

According to her LinkedIn account, Rebecca left her job as managing director of the Irwin's Australia Zoo in December 2015.

During her tenure, she oversaw 'multiple food outlets' at the Sunshine Coast tourist attraction, as well as 'catering and functions'.

New look Rebecca: During her tenure, she oversaw 'multiple food outlets' at the Sunshine Coast tourist attraction, as well as 'catering and functions'

In 2016, the Courier Mail reported that Rebecca, who is now working as a restaurant manager near her home in Mooloolaba, had cut all ties with Australia Zoo.

Around this time, her father Frank Muscillo - who is married to Steve Irwin's sister Joy - was 'marched off the premises' after a disagreement with Terri.

The Muscillo family, including Joy and Rebecca's brother James, are believed to have no involvement whatsoever in the company today.
description: She may hail from the same wholesome Irwin clan as animal conservationist Bindi.
authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
